2025.title: Biotech market forecast hits $5.85T by 2034
2025.description: In 2025, global biotech valuation ranged from $1.03T to $1.68T with projections hitting $5.85T by 2034, driven by precision medicine, gene therapies, and synthetic biology.

2025.title: CRISPR + lipid delivery breakthroughs expand reach
2025.description: Biotech firms advanced CRISPR gene editing with lipid nanoparticle delivery systems in 2025, improving targeting, delivery, and scalability for in vivo applications.

2025.title: AI-led pipelines scale drug discovery
2025.description: Companies like Exscientia expanded AI-managed clinical pipelines in 2025, enhancing success rates and drastically reducing discovery timelines.

2025.title: Synthetic biology scales biomanufacturing
2025.description: 2025 saw synthetic biology advance scalable biomanufacturing for biofuels, enzymes, and pharmaceuticals, supported by engineered microbes and fermentation breakthroughs.

2025.title: 3D bioprinting grows for implants and organoids
2025.description: Bioprinting startups delivered tissue and cartilage models, while research groups printed patient-specific organoids for drug screening and regenerative medicine.

2025.title: Real-world evidence (RWE) trials gain global traction
2025.description: Biopharma companies increasingly adopted RWE trials in 2025 to support regulatory submissions, integrating wearable data and digital biomarkers.

2025.title: Biotech startups boom: epigenetics & proteomics
2025.description: Over 5,800 startups were active in 2025, with major VC interest in epigenetics, single-cell proteomics, and spatial transcriptomics driving a new innovation wave.

2025.title: Automation reshapes biomanufacturing
2025.description: Biotech labs adopted robotics, cloud-native LIMS, and AI scheduling systems for end-to-end automated workflows, improving throughput and reproducibility.

2025.title: EU & global biotech regulatory frameworks updated
2025.description: In 2025, the EU and other jurisdictions reformed biotech regulations, introducing harmonized R&D approval, gene therapy fast lanes, and cross-border trial rules.
